channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of stain (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 3 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, co no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080251
item.description:
Report X-2023080251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL STAGING AREA AWAY FROM PERSONNEL AND OTHER PACKAGES. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE PLASTIC BOTTLE HAS A HOLE, WHICH IS CASUING THE LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL PAIL AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023080242
item.description:
Report X-2023080242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING LOOKED AT AND INVESTIGATED ON WHETHER IT NEEDED TO BE RTS OR SENT ON TO CUSTOMER. LOOKED TO VERIFY IF THE HAZMAT CERT WAS ON FILE SINCE PRIOR SCANS SHOWED IT WAS SENT BACK TO THE SHIPPER ONCE ALREADY. WHEN PKG WAS PICKED UP OFF THE GROUND, THE BOTTOM FELL OUT AND 3 BOTTLES BUSTED. THE DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO KEEP IT CONTAINED AND PKG WAS SECURED. GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG ALONG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG. DescribePack: BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND EMPLOYEE WHO LIFTED THE PKG WAS UNAWARE OF THAT. BOX FELL APART. CONTENTS FELL OUT OF THE BOTTOM. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DIRT WAS PUT OVER THE LIQUID TO ABSORB AND THE GLASS WAS SWEPT UP AND PUT IN THE HAZMAT BAG WITH THE REST OF THE PKG

item.title: Report X-2023080195
item.description:
Report X-2023080195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While being loaded onto delivery truck, the package handler noticed that the package was damp. He set it aside and informed QA of its condition and location. DescribePack: 4 of the 6 bottles had either loose seals, or their spray triggers were loose. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package placed in a hazmat bag, and was taken to the nearest QA cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023080923
item.description:
Report X-2023080923

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA Hazmat cage. During inspection it was found that the cap on the 5- gallon jug had failed to oporate. This caused a large amount of liquid to pour out of the plastic container. After the inspection was complete all contents within the package and jug were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent vaper and liquid from causing further damage. DescribePack: The failure was caused by the cap failing to operate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I attempted to tighten the jug but failed to do so as the cap was night airtight, and you could hear air escaping the closure. Package and all contents were placed into a hazmat bag tightened closed and placed into a 20-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2023080149
item.description:
Report X-2023080149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over to QA then was placed in a lined tote and prepped for processing at our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package was brought over and there were giant holes on either side of the box due to the bottles inside leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and bottles both placed in the bag to prevent leaking and any spillage was cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2023080087
item.description:
Report X-2023080087

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BELT MANAGER NOTICED A STAIN ON SIDE OF BOX SO WE OPENED AND INSPECTED. THERE WERE LOOSE CAPS ON ALL OF THE BOTTLES AND 1 OF THE BOTTLES RELEASED ABOUT 7 OUNCES OF LIQUID AND CONTAMINATED ALL 4 OF THE BOTTLES. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PUT UNDER THE HOOD VENT TO AIR OUT.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package had been showing signs of internal leakage. package had been placed in a black bin and set aside so it would not damage any other packages in area. DescribePack: package had a loose cap and leaked out contents inside of the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was set in black bin and moved aside away from other packages.

item.title: Report E-2023070968
item.description:
Report E-2023070968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MORRISVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of floor break (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the poly inner 1 gallon bottle had released 0.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
